repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
- Exposing the raw config as table is a pattern not seen anywhere else in the Nvim codebase.
- Old spellfile.vim docs still available, no new documentation

Solution:
- Exposing a `config()` function that both acts as "getter" and "setter" is a much more common idiom (e.g. vim.lsp, vim.diagnostic).
- Add new documentation and link old docs to |spellfile.lua| instead of |spellfile.vim|.

Closes: #36473

comment_data.body: This is already described in the SPELL FILE MISSING section below. Doesn't need to be repeated.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -313,10 +313,6 @@ Only the first file is loaded, the one that is first in 'runtimepath'.  If
 this succeeds then additionally files with the name LL.EEE.add.spl are loaded.
 All the ones that are found are used.
 
-If no spell file is found the |SpellFileMissing| autocommand event is
-triggered.  This may trigger the |spellfile.vim| plugin to offer you
-downloading the spell file.
-

comment_data.body: Should this tag just be `*spellfile.config()*` to not pollute the `nvim*` tags? Note this pattern might change in the future due to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34557
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -166,6 +166,55 @@ trim_trailing_whitespace               *editorconfig.trim_trailing_whitespace*
     buffer is written.
 
 
+==============================================================================
+Builtin plugin: spellfile                                      *spellfile.lua*
+
+Asks the user to download missing spellfiles. The spellfile is written to
+`stdpath('data') .. 'site/spell'` or the first writable directory in the
+'runtimepath'.
+
+The plugin can be disabled by setting `g:loaded_spellfile_plugin = 1`.
+
+
+*nvim.spellfile.Opts*
+    A table with the following fields:
+
+    Fields: ~
+      â€¢ {url}         (`string`) The base URL from where the spellfiles are
+                      downloaded. Uses `g:spellfile_URL` if it's set,
+                      otherwise https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell.
+      â€¢ {timeout_ms}  (`integer`, default: 15000) Number of milliseconds after
+                      which the |vim.net.request| times out.
+
+
+config({opts})                                       *nvim.spellfile.config()*

@@ -95,6 +95,8 @@ Defaults                                            *defaults* *nvim-defaults*
 
 - |editorconfig| plugin is enabled, .editorconfig settings are applied.
 - |man.lua| plugin is enabled, so |:Man| is available by default.
+- |spellfile.lua| plugin is enabled, spellfiles are installed by default if
+  missing.
 - |matchit| plugin is enabled. To disable it in your config: >vim

comment_data.body:
sure. `require('nvim.spellfile')` is how it's called, but yes "spellfile" is already a helptag family owned by Nvim.

(I really need to sit down and think about #34557 ...)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -166,6 +166,55 @@ trim_trailing_whitespace               *editorconfig.trim_trailing_whitespace*
     buffer is written.
 
 
+==============================================================================
+Builtin plugin: spellfile                                      *spellfile.lua*
+
+Asks the user to download missing spellfiles. The spellfile is written to
+`stdpath('data') .. 'site/spell'` or the first writable directory in the
+'runtimepath'.
+
+The plugin can be disabled by setting `g:loaded_spellfile_plugin = 1`.
+
+
+*nvim.spellfile.Opts*
+    A table with the following fields:
+
+    Fields: ~
+      â€¢ {url}         (`string`) The base URL from where the spellfiles are
+                      downloaded. Uses `g:spellfile_URL` if it's set,
+                      otherwise https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell.
+      â€¢ {timeout_ms}  (`integer`, default: 15000) Number of milliseconds after
+                      which the |vim.net.request| times out.
+
+
+config({opts})                                       *nvim.spellfile.config()*

comment_data.body:
in theory it's also supposed to activate spelling in the buffer, I think. but I don't think that ever worked very well.

`load_file` is a weird name for a "download" function anyway. If we are going to document this, need to name it a bit better, maybe `get` or `request` (both are in `:help dev-naming`)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -166,6 +166,55 @@ trim_trailing_whitespace               *editorconfig.trim_trailing_whitespace*
     buffer is written.
 
 
+==============================================================================
+Builtin plugin: spellfile                                      *spellfile.lua*
+
+Asks the user to download missing spellfiles. The spellfile is written to
+`stdpath('data') .. 'site/spell'` or the first writable directory in the
+'runtimepath'.
+
+The plugin can be disabled by setting `g:loaded_spellfile_plugin = 1`.
+
+
+*nvim.spellfile.Opts*
+    A table with the following fields:
+
+    Fields: ~
+      â€¢ {url}         (`string`) The base URL from where the spellfiles are
+                      downloaded. Uses `g:spellfile_URL` if it's set,
+                      otherwise https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell.
+      â€¢ {timeout_ms}  (`integer`, default: 15000) Number of milliseconds after
+                      which the |vim.net.request()| times out.
+
+
+config({opts})                                       *nvim.spellfile.config()*
+    Configure spellfile download options. For example: >lua
+        require('nvim.spellfile').config({ url = '...' })
+<
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      â€¢ {opts}  (`nvim.spellfile.Opts?`) When omitted or `nil`, retrieve the
+                current configuration. Otherwise, a configuration table (see
+                |nvim.spellfile.Opts|).
+
+    Return: ~
+        (`nvim.spellfile.Opts?`) Current config if {opts} is omitted.
+
+load_file({lang})                                 *nvim.spellfile.load_file()*
+    Download spellfiles for language {lang} if available.

comment_data.body: `see [nvim.spellfile.Opts]` should never need to be mentioned in the docstring for that very same thing :) The help system or LSP should deal with that. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36205 may help.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,22 +1,56 @@
+--- @brief
+--- Asks the user to download missing spellfiles. The spellfile is written to
+--- `stdpath('data') .. 'site/spell'` or the first writable directory in the
+--- 'runtimepath'.
+---
+--- The plugin can be disabled by setting `g:loaded_spellfile_plugin = 1`.
+
 local M = {}
 
---- @class vim.spellfile.Config
+--- @class nvim.spellfile.Info
+--- @inlinedoc
+--- @field files string[]
+--- @field key string
+--- @field lang string
+--- @field encoding string
+--- @field dir string
+
+--- A table with the following fields:
+--- @class nvim.spellfile.Opts
+---
+--- The base URL from where the spellfiles are downloaded. Uses `g:spellfile_URL`
+--- if it's set, otherwise https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell.
 --- @field url string
+---
+--- Number of milliseconds after which the [vim.net.request()] times out.
+--- (default: 15000)
 --- @field timeout_ms integer
 
----@class vim.spellfile.Info
----@field files string[]
----@field key string
----@field lang string
----@field encoding string
----@field dir string
-
----@type vim.spellfile.Config
-M.config = {
-  url = 'https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell',
+--- @type nvim.spellfile.Opts
+local config = {
+  url = vim.g.spellfile_URL or 'https://ftp.nluug.nl/pub/vim/runtime/spell',
   timeout_ms = 15000,
 }
 
+--- Configure spellfile download options. For example:
+--- ```lua
+--- require('nvim.spellfile').config({ url = '...' })
+--- ```
+--- @param opts nvim.spellfile.Opts? When omitted or `nil`, retrieve the
+---   current configuration. Otherwise, a configuration table (see [nvim.spellfile.Opts]).

comment_data.body:
not sure how i missed this. we really need custom lint rules!


```suggestion
  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.spellfile', {}),
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,16 +1,12 @@
-vim.g.loaded_spellfile_plugin = true
-
---- Downloads missing .spl file.
----
---- @param args { bufnr: integer, match: string }
-local function on_spellfile_missing(args)
-  local spellfile = require('nvim.spellfile')
-  spellfile.load_file(args.match)
+if vim.g.loaded_spellfile_plugin ~= nil then
+  return
 end
+vim.g.loaded_spellfile_plugin = true
 
 vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('SpellFileMissing', {
-  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim_spellfile', { clear = true }),
-  pattern = '*',
+  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim_spellfile', {}),

comment_data.body: Yep this was a workaround until that PR is merged ðŸ˜…. I'll remove it

comment_data.body:
> (I really need to sit down and think about #34557 ...)

Yeah would be nice to have a clear picture for built-in plugins. I have some thoughts about it, but I haven't fully thought it through. 

When a decision has been made I can help with the clean-up :)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: spellfile: switch to config() function and improve docs
